Out on the road for the majority of each day, you'll be visiting your customers on a regular call cycle and driving growth within each store. If you're looking for an exciting new career - and one that's packed with opportunity - we want to hear from you!§The Role.§Reporting to the Sales Manager, you'll be the face of our company - you'll be out in the trade working with our customers to develop our business as well as theirs. You'll be responsible for increasing sales volume and ranging, ensuring stores are well executed, and working in partnership with your customers to grow their business and ours.  On top of this, you'll constantly identify new opportunities, with a focus on new business acquisition. Your competitive edge and drive to meet targets, teamed with a passion for building strong relationships, will ensure success in this role. Most importantly, you'll think strategically in your selling approach and understand your customers' needs - your forward-thinking approach will drive exceptional results for Amatil NZ and for your customers alike. From time to time you may be required to travel out of town to cover other parts of our Lower North Island Region.§ §What Do I Need?§Drive, motivation, resilience, and a strong passion for sales! If you're the type of person who cringes at the thought of second place, you're on the right track. Your high level of customer focus will drive your ability to build positive working relationships with a large number of customers, and you'll have strong negotiation skills. Your strong commercial acumen and strategic focus will enable you to increase Amatil NZ presence and performance within your market - you'll be able to identify new opportunities and will be comfortable with cold-calling new potential customers. On top of all of this, you'll demonstrate passion and energy in your work, and will pass on the passion for our brands to your customers and consumers alike! §The Benefits.§On top of your starting salary (reviewed every 6 months), you'll also receive a $650 annual product allowance and a company-branded car, along with shares, superannuation, and the opportunity to earn an annual sales incentive. Pretty sweet! Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your career path will take you!§The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil NZ. § § Applications close 13 September 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50534869.txt	§Banqer Sales & Support Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Banqer Sales & Support Manager§§Advertiser: §Banqer§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Management§§§§§§Banqer Primary - Sales and Support Consultant§ §Banqer is New Zealand’s leading financial EdTech start-up, with Banqer Primary, serving over half of all New Zealand primary and intermediate schools. We’re on a mission to ensure that all kids are prepared for the financial world ahead, and we achieve this through our simulative classroom based software.§ §As an EdTech, education and people are at the core of our business, but so too is technology. Being a team founded by developers and an educator we’re a market leader both locally and internationally. We are continuously growing and striving to have the greatest impact we can on individuals and local communities. We believe this is why we’re leading the pack when it comes to financial education software.§ §Our Flagship product, Banqer Primary, is now used by thousands of teachers and tens of thousands of students nationwide, and we’re excited to see this growth continue.§ §The role§ §This Sales and Support role is based in Christchurch, working closely with your Sydney based counterpart and our Apprentice Head of Sales, and reports to the COO. You’ll take ownership of the entire NZ market, with a strong focus on executing a sales and support strategy within the primary and intermediate school sector.§ §Your focus will be the educators who use Banqer. Through outbound sales, you’ll be in charge of growing the user base, retaining new conversions, reengaging existing users year on year, and ensuring the educational experience of the solution remains the industry leader. § §There is plenty of independence and opportunity to make the role your own, and work alongside a highly motivated team. You’ll work closely with the entire team who will contribute to your success in the role, however, you’ll have the luxury of end to end responsibility of the business lifecycle.§ §Although you’ll be based at our Christchurch HQ you will spend a bit of your time 'on the road' (when business as usual circumstances resume, on average 5 days a month, including some overnight trips) focusing on identifying and converting new business opportunities whilst building strong and effective working relationships with existing educators. You’ll also use your time on the road to better understand the product and other education opportunities for the solutions we build§ §Who you are§ §We ask that you come to work ready to play, bringing your best, and being ready to contribute to our team culture. That you’ll seek ways to make things better; to question and challenge, contribute solutions to get involved and have a voice. Banqer team members equally celebrate their wins and own up to their failures, with a focus on always improving. You’ll be able to work with the entire team to ensure that our products, technology and customer service continue to set the standard for financial education.§ §We have ambitious plans for 2021 and beyond. As such, we are currently looking for talented and committed team members to help us reach our goals and achieve our mission.§ §What you'll need to be successful§ §End to end business development or sales experience in a Software as a Service (SaaS) company or experience as an educator;§ §Strong interpersonal skills and a hunter mentality;§ §Comprehensive understanding of the New Zealand schooling system and curriculum is desirable;§ §You’ll enjoy the opportunity of working autonomously and being self-directed/motivated and taking ownership of a large market;§ §You’ll be comfortable both presenting Banqer to a group 50 teachers and picking up the phone to ring a school Principal you’ve never spoken to before to organise an in-person demo (and on the odd occasion, being told relatively directly that they’re not interested!);§ §Creative approach to building your network, enjoying social interaction and relationship building; and§ §Ability to regularly travel around New Zealand for educator visits as well as the potential occasional trip abroad.§ §What you'll get§ §The ability to make a positive social impact everyday§ §Ownership of a large territory § §Autonomy in your role§ §Plenty of growth opportunities§ §Work alongside dedicated team members who want to see you succeed§ §Annual professional development allowance§ §Competitive base salary + target based sales bonus§ §Company laptop and phone bills covered§ §Why Banqer?§ §Named New Zealand’s 2018 Start-up of the Year at the prestigious Hi Tech awards, Banqer is a well known name in the New Zealand EdTech world. That said, we’re still currently a small, tight knit team (seven of us to be precise) we simply pack a big punch.§ §We know what we’re about and where we’re going in the next five year and it’s going to be a fun ride. We’d say our spirit animal has to be ‘Coink’ the flying pig who is one of a kind and doesn’t listen when people tell him something’s impossible - he makes it happen.§ §We value diversity of thought and are looking to build a team that understands that we’re for all New Zealanders. We invest in our team to allow them to invest in us and our mission. The Banqer team works hard but is rewarded for their efforts through inclusion, flexibility, autonomy, and the support needed to grow yourself and your role.§ § §Applications close 30 September 2020§§§§

Out on the road for the majority of each day, you'll be visiting your customers on a regular call cycle and driving growth within each store. If you're looking for an exciting new career - and one that's packed with opportunity - we want to hear from you!§The Role.§Reporting to the Sales Manager, you'll be the face of our company - you'll be out in the trade working with our customers to develop our business as well as theirs. You'll be responsible for increasing sales volume and ranging, ensuring stores are well executed, and working in partnership with your customers to grow their business and ours.  On top of this, you'll constantly identify new opportunities, with a focus on new business acquisition. Your competitive edge and drive to meet targets, teamed with a passion for building strong relationships, will ensure success in this role. Most importantly, you'll think strategically in your selling approach and understand your customers' needs - your forward-thinking approach will drive exceptional results for Amatil NZ and for your customers alike.§What Do I Need?§Drive, motivation, resilience, and a strong passion for sales! If you're the type of person who cringes at the thought of second place, you're on the right track. Your high level of customer focus will drive your ability to build positive working relationships with a large number of customers, and you'll have strong negotiation skills. Your strong commercial acumen and strategic focus will enable you to increase Amatil NZ presence and performance across all categories within your market - you'll be able to identify new opportunities and will be comfortable with cold-calling new potential customers. On top of all of this, you'll demonstrate passion and energy in your work, and will pass on the passion for our brands to your customers and consumers alike! §The Benefits.§On top of your starting salary (reviewed every 6 months), you'll also receive a $650 annual product allowance and a company-branded car, along with shares, superannuation, and the opportunity to earn an annual sales incentive. Pretty sweet! Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your career path will take you!§The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil NZ. § §Applications close 23 September.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

nationwide program launching in February 2021 provides untagged funding for all registered community groups while bringing together people from all generations to support local businesses and grow the NZ economy as a whole.§  §Role and Team:§  §Reporting to the General Manager and management team, this role is responsible for recruitment, management and coordination of all field staff, resources, partners, external providers and mentors to deliver the licensed programme throughout Waikato, Bay of Plenty & Gisborne with a heavy focus on ensuring high quality outcomes for programme participants while meeting membership registration targets through our website and backend systems.§  §Main Functions§ § §Identification and development of strategic local community groups & business owners to encourage program membership§ §Responsible for the recruitment and development of field staff in your region§ §Relationship management of all program partners§ §Drive marketing and communications, growing the brand and engaging the community and local businesses in your region§ §Responsibility for assisting planning and reporting on memberships using in-house systems§ §Training and coaching a team of up to 40 field staff to drive program membership§ §Building relationships with key internal and external stakeholders§ §Presentations to community groups & business owners while reporting on team performance to management§ §Oversight of programme delivery and governance§ §Management of risk, human resource and health & safety within your local team§ §Provide feedback on funding applications that apply to your region§ §On-going auditing of the ‘CommUnity Fund’ recipients within your region§ §About you:§  §You’re someone who sets and pursues ambitious and challenging goals with a focus on the bigger picture. You thrive on the responsibility of working across an entire organisation with the ability to bring people together to deliver positive outcomes. Some of the qualities you will bring to the role are;§ § §Excellent communication skills with the ability to build and maintain long term community & business relationships to grow our brand and encourage membership§ §Business planning and development experience, promoting the organisation and building a strong relationship with influencers, community groups and business owners§ §Ability to liaise & partner effectively with key stakeholders§ §Resilient by nature however is passionate about people and NZ communities§ §Strong financial and commercial acumen§ §A high level of personal presentation, organisation and accountability§ §Team player with management and mentoring capability to get the best out of your team§ §Preferably have significant networks of business owners and community groups that you can access to encourage program membership§ §Have a reasonable level of IT understanding with proven experience in using MS Office (Word, Excel, E-mail, etc)§ §Benefits:§ § §A rewarding role creating positive and financial outcomes for all NZ community groups while providing the opportunity to grow revenue for NZ businesses.§ §Chance to have an impact on staff development and programme delivery with accountability for all aspects of the CommUnity program.§ §Be part of a new generation, custom built program that benefits all New Zealanders.§ §Package:§ § §You will be provided with a generous base salary starting from $80,000 p.a, $12,000 p.a car allowance (you must provide your own reliable vehicle), fuel card, tools of the trade (mobile phone, tablet), entertainment allowance, sales kit and marketing material.§ §As part of your induction we will provide full on-going training on the program operation, membership benefits, member registration process, CRM management and backend systems to help support you in your role as well as the team of field sales representatives under your control.§ §If you love helping others and you are driven by the opportunity to create a positive social impact in your region and together across all regions of NZ within a well-rounded management role, we would love to hear from you so please apply through the application link. §  §Please apply with a cover letter and mention your region in your application.§  §Applications close on Sunday 4th October 2020. We will respond to your application after that time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a regional manager?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

PlaceMakers is New Zealand's leading and largest supplier of building materials to New Zealand’s commercial and residential construction markets. Part of New Zealand’s largest listed company, Fletcher Building, we employ more than 2,100 people in over 60 locations across the country and stock more than 100,000 product lines from concrete to paint and plasterboard.§§ §PlaceMakers continuously strives to be the best building partner in the market and takes pride in providing the highest level of service to our customers. jobText: TXT/50599419.txt	§National Sales Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Sales Manager§§Advertiser: §McGrath Nurseries 2019 Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Management§§§§§§National Sales Manager§§The Company §McGrath Nurseries is recognised as the country’s leading fruit tree grower, with over 30 years’ experience growing stone and pip fruit trees from our two nursery bases near Cambridge in the Waikato. With a reputation for being the industry innovator, a recent change in ownership sees us in expansion mode and as a result, we are looking to employ a high calibre National Sales Manager to take responsibility for sales across a number of markets in both the North and South island. §The Opportunity§Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer and part of our senior team, you will be accountable for providing inspirational sales leadership to help us achieve sustainable growth in several key Pip and Stone fruit market sectors. §The Role and You §This role involves working closely with our existing customer base providing a heightened level of service and support as well as working with the CEO in identifying and building new business. You will have highly effective communication and relationship-building skills and a practical and analytical approach to problem solving, with great negotiation skills and a killer attitude. §The practical nature of our industry means this is a very hands on role and we are looking for someone who excels in the face to face relationship aspect of sales and who has a proven history of building strong long term relationships with customers. Extensive and regular travel will be part of the brief as time in the field is critical to assisting us achieve our goals. §As a key member of the senior team, you will also play a part in managing the overall McGrath business by providing an interface between our nurseries and our customers. As part of the leadership team, you need to have proven experience in both strategic and operational sales roles. Strong business acumen and commercial knowledge as well as hands-on knowledge of the orchard industry and a strong affinity, understanding and connection with the pip and stone fruit sector is essential.§ §What Do We Offer?§We offer a competitive remuneration package including a good base salary, company vehicle, tools of trade and a performance bonus.§We are also open to flexibility around location, as getting the right person is important for us, and we have Zoom!! . Although regular travel to our Head Office in Cambridge would be required.§This is an excellent opportunity to drive your career forward with a business that likes to take action and is growing, and to become part of a close-knit team with the knowledge that your contribution makes a difference! §For further information contact Derek Edwards, CEO McGrath Nurseries 2019§Applicants for this role must have NZ residency or a valid work visa.§Applications close 14 October. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of sales management experience do you have?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§How far are you willing to travel for work?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

It involves stewarding them through the sales process until they are signed up, and then handing them over to the programme team to deliver the coaching or training programme. § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Doing good - helping NZ businesses survive and thrive through the economic recession§ § § §Our vision is to improve the lives of 10 million indigenous people. Maori enterprises are key clients, but not our only clients. § § § §Meet and learn from interesting entrepreneurs, business experts and cultural leaders§ § § §Flexible working hours to fit in with other commitments in your life (manage your time to achieve weekly, monthly & quarterly targets) § § § §Work from anywhere, including home, so no need to sit in traffic§ § § §Phone plan paid for (unlimited calls, texts, 2GB data)§ § § §If you’re average, you can earn $60K with us. If you are a star, you can earn $200K plus. Young or old, if you have the stuff, we’ll know.§ § § § §There are not many places out there where you can 'do good', learn heaps, work with cool people on cool projects, engage at the coalface to help solve real issues, make money, have fun and have the flexibility for the work to fit in with your lifestyle!§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Consultative phone selling experience – ideally having sold to Māori organisations before.§ § § §Comfortable with cold calling on the phone and building rapport.§ § § §Writing ability - so you can structure clear and convincing proposals from client notes.§ § § §Proactive - use your initiative and take self-directed action to achieve results.§ § § §Eager to learn - willing to deal with changes as our products evolve and take ideas on new ideas around sales (e.g. digital marketing) for the NZ SME and Māori enterprise market.§ § § §Good communication with a diverse range of people.§ § § §Competency in diagnosing and solving clients' business challenges.§ § § §Able to listen well and empathise with clients when they are conveying their challenges to you.§ § § §Familiarity with te reo Māori is preferred - given that some Māori words, phrases and names are common with our clients.§ § § §Able to progress multiple sales projects at once at different stages. § § § §Optimist - able to deal with knockbacks since in the sales game, only some leads will convert to a sale.§ § § §Self-disciplined and responsible - to make calls and regularly follow-up with your prospect list. § § § §Operates well as part of a team with an understanding of shared objectives and collective responsibility.§ § § §Experience with using a CRM, sales pipeline tool and document management.§ § § §Familiarity with funding processes are beneficial - given our clients often need funding support. This funding exists but needs to be applied for. § § § §Genuinely care about helping NZ businesses and Māori enterprises to grow - so that you relate to our clients.§ § § § §A DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION CAN BE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST§ § § §About the business§ §We are Te Whare Hukahuka (www.twh.co.nz) - a social enterprise that aims to improve the lives of 10 million indigenous people. Our impact comes from helping indigenous people grow enterprises which can create opportunities and prosperity in their families, their communities and their tribes. § §Much of our work over the past seven years has been running training programmes for Māori leaders (for more than 1,000 leaders from 120 Māori enterprises). TWH engages 10,000+ people on our Facebook page (good for lead generation). Our digital marketing processes increase leads and help with conversion. We have relationships with a range of funders (with the ability to get funding that covers 50%-100% of the costs of training) and have advised multiple Government agencies. § §TWH has also set up our own e-commerce business and has developed e-commerce training programmes and advisory services. Our e-commerce programmes solve a range of real challenges that NZ business owners have with succeeding online and growing their businesses. We constantly tweak and improve the programmes as we learn, and tailor our training to address their real challenges and stay relevant. Information about these programmes is available on our website. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have experience in a cold calls sales environment?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§How many years' experience do you have in telesales?§§§

jobText: TXT/50619966.txt	§Regional Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Regional Manager§§Advertiser: §Parkshire Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Salary§§$75,000 - $79,999 + extras = OTE - $110,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Account & Relationship Management§§§§§§Regional Manager §  §Are you someone who cares about the community, understands community groups and loves helping others? Are you a person who sets and pursues ambitious and challenging goals with a focus on being part of a bigger picture?§ § §Rewarding career providing never seen before positive outcomes for NZ communities and businesses§ §Multi-faceted regional management role§ §Ownership of strategy, business development and staff management of end to end program delivery§ §This is your opportunity to help make New Zealand the best place in the world to live, work & play§  §Company§  §Our mission is to make NZ the best place in the world to live, work & play providing positive social outcomes and financial growth for all NZ community groups and business owners. Operating throughout NZ and impacting almost the entire population, CommUnity is dedicated to helping grow NZ community groups to overcome obstacles and be successful in their chosen field.§  §Our nationwide program launching in February 2021 provides untagged funding for all registered community groups while bringing together people from all generations to support local businesses and grow the NZ economy as a whole.§  §Role and Team:§  §Reporting to the General Manager and management team, this role is responsible for recruitment, management and coordination of all field staff, resources, partners, external providers and mentors to deliver the licensed programme from the North Shore to the Far North, with a heavy focus on ensuring high quality outcomes for programme participants while meeting membership registration targets through our website and backend systems.§  §Main Functions§ § §Identification and development of strategic local community groups & business owners to encourage program membership§ §Responsible for the recruitment and development of field staff in your region§ §Relationship management of all program partners§ §Drive marketing and communications, growing the brand and engaging the community and local businesses in your region§ §Responsibility for assisting planning and reporting on memberships using in-house systems§ §Training and coaching a team of up to 40 field staff to drive program membership§ §Building relationships with key internal and external stakeholders§ §Presentations to community groups & business owners while reporting on team performance to management§ §Oversight of programme delivery and governance§ §Management of risk, human resource and health & safety within your local team§ §Provide feedback on funding applications that apply to your region§ §On-going auditing of the 'CommUnity Fund' recipients within your region§ §About you:§  §You're someone who sets and pursues ambitious and challenging goals with a focus on the bigger picture. You thrive on the responsibility of working across an entire organisation with the ability to bring people together to deliver positive outcomes. Some of the qualities you will bring to the role are;§ § §Excellent communication skills with the ability to build and maintain long term community & business relationships to grow our brand and encourage membership§ §Business planning and development experience, promoting the organisation and building a strong relationship with influencers, community groups and business owners§ §Ability to liaise & partner effectively with key stakeholders§ §Resilient by nature however is passionate about people and NZ communities§ §Strong financial and commercial acumen§ §A high level of personal presentation, organisation and accountability§ §Team player with management and mentoring capability to get the best out of your team§ §Preferably have significant networks of business owners and community groups that you can access to encourage program membership§ §Have a reasonable level of IT understanding with proven experience in using MS Office (Word, Excel, E-mail, etc)§ §Benefits:§ § §A rewarding role creating positive and financial outcomes for all NZ community groups while providing the opportunity to grow revenue for NZ businesses.§ §Chance to have an impact on staff development and programme delivery with accountability for all aspects of the CommUnity program.§ §Be part of a new generation, custom built program that benefits all New Zealanders.§ §Package:§ § §You will be provided with a generous base salary starting from $80,000 p.a, $12,000 p.a car allowance (you must provide your own reliable vehicle), fuel card, tools of the trade (mobile phone, tablet), entertainment allowance, sales kit and marketing material.§ §As part of your induction we will provide full on-going training on the program operation, membership benefits, member registration process, CRM management and backend systems to help support you in your role as well as the team of field sales representatives under your control.§ §If you love helping others and you are driven by the opportunity to create a positive social impact in your region and together across all regions of NZ within a well-rounded management role, we would love to hear from you so please apply through the application link. §  §Please apply with a cover letter and mention your region in your application.§  §Applications close on Sunday 4th October 2020. We will respond to your application after that time.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a regional manager?§How many years' experience do you have in a client services / account management role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

Just Water is the leading player in the supply of filtered, chilled water to New Zealand business and homes since 1989 and Hometech has been providing and installing home improvement products like Solatube and Unovent to New Zealanders since 1992 and has more than 70,000 customers across the country. § §We are a values-based organisation: Fun, Integrity, Respect, Service and Trust. Our values shape and drive our culture. We strive to bring them to life in our business and recognise and celebrate when we do just that.§ §Now we need all your talents to join us and assist in the development, delivery and implementation of the strategic sales plan that will unlock the next stage of our growth.§ §You know sales, proposals, negotiations and all the personalities that go with it, but it is your ability to galvanise people around you, show them the vision and then inspire and lead them towards it that makes you stand out.§ §You are charismatic and command attention, but you also value your team and you bring a strong set of values to the table.  You are the kind of person, people want to follow, and you’re genuine and can build empathy easily.  You always get picked first when a crisis is brewing and there is never any drama or fuss, just a sensible, realistic solution.§ §You have bucket loads of new business experience and can instill a passion for it in others.  You‘re a great coach and you understand the importance of delivering through your team and empowering others to get things done all the while ready to jump in and lead by example.§ §Resilient, realistic and determined, you’ll motivate and lead this geographically spread team.  You back yourself; You'll ensure our products are effectively executed in the market and will be responsible for implementing our CCANZ sales strategies across your territory.  Strategic relationship-building skills will be key in this role, as you'll be dealing with everyone from the store person to the owners of multi-million-dollar supermarkets - and establishing win-win relationships will be key. You'll be working with some of our biggest customers and will be tasked with achieving some big targets for us - if you cringe at the thought of second place, this is the role for you!§What Do I Need? §To be a star performer in this role, you'll have strong commercial acumen, a resilient approach to your work, plus whole lot of drive and energy! With a solid understanding of how CCA operate in the sales space, you'll have demonstrated strong selling skills, and will have proven experience in driving business negotiation skills. On top of this, you'll have a customer-focused approach that will successfully enable you to drive your customers and entire territory towards success. You'll be resilient, adaptable - and given the fast pace of our business, you'll be able to effectively think on your feet. This truly is a role where no two days are the same!§ §We're looking for a high performer with the desire and passion to prove themselves - whether you’re looking for your next step in Grocery or looking to gain cross-channel experience within FMCG - or step in to field sales all-together - we want to hear from you.§The Benefits§.§On top of your starting salary (reviewed every 6 months), you'll also receive a $650 annual product allowance and a company-branded car, along with shares, superannuation, and the opportunity to earn an annual sales incentive. Pretty sweet! Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your career path will take you!§The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil.§Please gain support from your manager for your application. Any queries regarding the process or timelines, please contact Shobita Singh Patel.§ Applications close  12 October 2020§§§§

You earn on every dollar you make for us, which sees our BDMs earning on target $160,000 with higher performers earning well in excess of $250,000 and above per year§ §Extensive professional product training and ongoing coaching§ §Incredible incentives for high performers, including annual overseas trips, quarterly bonuses of up to $25,000, yearly car incentives and more!§ §A company car with fuel card which can be used for business and personal use§ §Selling a highly needed product into the SME market space§ §A fun, supportive and collaborative team§ §An active social committee who organise company-wide events and celebrations§ §Quarterly conferences and events along with yearly sales conferences/award ceremonies!§ § § § § § § §Why join Employsure?§ § Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. jobText: TXT/50664846.txt	§Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sales§, §New Business Development§§§§§§Fixed Term until 27 Feb 2021§ §As a Business Development Manager in our Auckland Licensed channel, you'll have the chance to take on a new challenge in your sales career, take ownership of a Licensed territory and build your skill set in this sector. You'll be responsible for managing and growing existing customer relationships while strategically targeting new business and maintaining the direction and pipeline projects within this territory. You'll grow our brands through your strategic thinking and exceptional execution - and constantly seek new opportunities for Amatil NZ in the market place. You'll be focusing on our On-Premise customers, working with our entire product portfolio and building strategic relationships with our key customers in the market.§ §What Do I Need?§This is a fixed-term position reporting into the Licensed Sales Manager. You'll have proven success in FMCG sales, ideally in a Licensed environment, with a strong grasp on contracting new and existing customers, as well as an understanding of the unique business environments in which our Licensed BDMs operate. Your energetic and dynamic approach to your work, teamed with your commercial acumen and strategic decision-making skills, will enable you to efficiently and effectively get results within this territory and to maintain the strong existing customer relationships. You'll be comfortable dealing with large accounts and will be able to effectively present business proposals to customers, and identify new opportunities. You'll be an expert negotiator and able to get your pitch across the line - strong written and verbal communication skills are a must! § §The Benefits§You'll get a fantastic competitive salary and company branded car -  and not to mention plenty of complimentary product.  It doesn't get much better than that!  Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your CCANZ career path will take you! § §The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil.§ §Applications close 14 October 2020. § § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

vehicle safety checklists, preparing quotes, etc (training provided)§ §Managing consignment stock rotation and stock levels for your customer base§ §Assist with battery checking, charging, and testing as required (training provided)§ §Collection of used batteries for correct battery recycling§ §Establishing genuine customer relationships, customer prospecting/cold calling§ §Assist with branch inventory and stock take when required§ § § §About YOU§ § §You will have previous experience within a sales/delivery or account management position§ §You hold a current manual drivers’ licence, as this is essential.  DG endorsement would be advantageous but not essential§ §You are comfortable approaching new businesses and enjoy the challenge of turning leads into happy customers§ §You can plan your own schedule and work autonomously§ §You love and thrive off delivering good old-fashioned service, and are happiest in a hands-on role, providing customer value§ §Good presentation is essential, as you are the face of the Company (uniform provided)§ §You have strong communication skills and are comfortable speaking to all personalities§ §You are physically FIT and healthy as some heavy lifting is involved§ §You have basic computer skills§ §You love sales – without the suit and tie!§ §You have a great sense of humour and are looking for your new 'work family'!§ §Previous experience in the battery or automotive trade would be an advantage, but not essential.§ § § §What makes this position SO GREAT?§ §Aside from the Company culture, which is hard working and fun-loving, you will be working with a passionate group of people who are committed to what they are doing. This is reflected in the growth of our business.§ § §Our doors are wide open for you to build your career with training and development§ §Staff discounts§ §Competitive remuneration§ §Uniform supplied§ §Employee Assistance Program§ §Enjoy the workplace culture of a privately owned family business§ §After 1 year have your Birthday day off!!§  § § How to APPLY§ §We thank you for considering R&J Batteries as your future employer and we welcome your interest in joining our small but committed team. Click the §Apply §button below and submit your application including a copy of your most updated Resume.§ §As this is a full-time position, all applicants must hold permanent full working rights in New Zealand.§ § § §A little bIt ABOUT US§ §Established in 1996, the philosophy of always delivering outstanding customer service combined with superior product range and quality has seen R&J Batteries continue to grow and develop into Australia’s and New Zealand’s fastest growing battery company.  A true force throughout Australia & New Zealand in the supply of batteries for all applications including automotive, commercial, motorcycle, marine, deep cycle, solar and industrial batteries.  In October 2017, the Company commenced operations in Onehunga and Christchurch followed in December last year.§ § § §R&J Batteries utilises on-line behavioural questionnaire's as part of the selection process for shortlisted candidates. §Successful applicants will be required to undergo a pre-employment medical, police check and show a driving history report.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a sales representative?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you licensed and confident to drive a manual vehicle? Where creativity, innovation and continuous learning are encouraged and celebrated. Whether you're after a workplace with a social vibe or a workplace which understands your family, sport or a side gig is the priority or something in between - Xero can be all of that and more.§ §We're a huge part of the small business community and you'll find Xeros attending and speaking at conferences and hosting meetups. This role will be office based 3-4 days per week with the remainder out on site visiting our clients.§ §The role will be a healthy split of account management (70%) and new business (30%), with the opportunity to make the role your own!§  § Key responsibilities might include:§ § §Visiting sites across the South Island, minimal overnight travel required§ §Keeping our client engaged and promote the Numat – Agri brand§ §Cold calling potential new clients and converting sales leads§ §Regular engagement with all of our clients to ensure our products are working for them§ §Coming up with creative solutions to support our clients’ needs§ §Support the sales team with adhoc projects & product development§ §Continuous improvement, always looking for innovative but practical ideas or methods that can be suggested to improve processes§ § §About Us§  § We are a family run business that design and create a variety of product solutions for our clients based in the Agri sector. We provide the best outcome possible for our clients and have always relied on our humble, hungry and smart team to make it happen.§  § We continue to evolve and with our well-established agri-business moving to offshore markets, and therefore are on the lookout for a new Business Development Manager to run our South Island portfolio.§  § §About You§  § You will be a successful relationship builder, have a hunter mentality and a high level of commercial acumen. Now you want to stretch, to step into a new space, a fresh place with scope to play, create and build on your experience and results. § §Haere mai! Come work at Creative HQ in a newly created role as our Sales Manager§.    § §Applications close 12PM WEDS 14 OCTOBER.§  § §Creative HQ is §NZ’s leading provider of highly structured innovation and collaboration programmes – we deliver inclusive and effective innovation outcomes for startups, corporates and government.§ §We are looking for a tenacious sales-focused professional to find new places, people and problems for Creative HQ's suite of services and products §to deliver strong value. We've got a plan to unleash the entrepreneurial and innovative potential in thousands of people inside hundreds of corporate businesses and government agencies over the next five years, in NZ and around the world. Your open mind and customer-centric sales experience will make you a natural leader in realising our commercial targets and growth story. We want your expertise, energy and leadership to find those people and bring them onboard.§ §As Creative HQ's Sales Manager, §you are at the nexus between our customer-facing client services team, the Chief Executive and exec leadership, and our marketing and engagement team. Supported by a sales operations manager, your remit is to find new clients, develop potential projects and engagements, and use your impact and influence alongside our brand, service and product offerings so Creative HQ continues to do transformational work with amazing agencies and organisations.  § §Specifically§, you would be :  § § § §Taking the lead role and responsibility for Creative HQ's corporate and government sales § § § §Driving sales strategy development including setting goals and operational sales plans§ § § §Contributing to the development of the company’s strategy in liaison with the SLT§ § § §Designing and implementing key sales initiatives § § § §Leading sales coaching for SLT and wider staff§ § § §Guiding the sales input for Creative HQ’s marketing and engagement function§ § §Your experience §will include:§ § § §More than 5 years’ sales and/or business development experience§ § § §A proven history of strong relationship building and maintenance § § § §Effective time management and organizational experience § § § §Evidence of your analytical capabilities and ability to translate complex requirements and situations into clear priorities and propositions§ § § §Senior strategic experience, including setting and executing sales strategies, alongside and within a leadership team§ § § §Process-driven approach to business development and sales§ § §Remuneration §for this role§ §has a variable component, engineered around Creative HQ meeting six-monthly sales objectives. Details will be shared with candidates early in the recruitment process.    § §All of our team become adept §at a range of things, playing to their strengths, and stepping into the opportunity that our diverse and dynamic portfolio of work offers every day. We want you to add to that mix with your enviable suite of talents and tricks. § §You get an inspiring and flexible place to be each day§. We'll buy you a nice computer, pay for your phone data and show you how to work the coffee machine. You choose where you sit, we work when and where we need to, including work-from-home part week if that's your thing. All of the team have side projects alongside their day job - building bikes, running startups and social enterprises, raising kids, brewing things, making music etc.     § §You will be uniquely amazing. §You'll have your own lens on the world, forged through your unique history, your hard times, lessons learned, and passions born. Your skillset will be excellent and established through your experience doing whatever led you here. However your world view has been shaped, we want your open mind and fresh perspective.  § §We hire people with the right attitude§, mindset, team fit and alignment with our purpose. This role is about being up for anything. You’ll be an excellent communicator with a sharp mind, a warm heart and deep sense of manaakitanga. You'll be open to mucking in on the daily grind or stepping forward and putting your hand up to try a new way of working. You’ll be keen to learn, as much as you are to share your learnings with others. § §The Creative HQ whānau §are a distinct and diverse bunch of highly talented people, who back each other every day. We are a high-functioning team that aims for excellence. We care about the people as well as the product, and about the environment and kaupapa we immerse ourselves in. We do what we do by being transformative and daring in how we work, staying connected to our community and always learning and stretching our minds.§ §Be part of a purpose-driven organisation that believes in solving the world’s problems through collaborative, inclusive and disciplined mahi.§ §KIA TERETERE! §Applications close 12PM WEDS 14 OCTOBER.§  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of business development experience do you have?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50681476.txt	§New Home Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§New Home Consultant§§Advertiser: §Signature Homes§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Sales Representatives/Consultants§§§§§§Looking to build a rewarding career in a boom industry? Signature Homes are on the hunt for another star to help even more New Zealanders build their dream homes.  § §About us § §Signature Homes was established in 1983 and from small beginnings is now one of New Zealand’s most successful and longest-standing residential building companies. Being spread across 14 locations, we are fortunate enough to be able to deliver quality design and construction right across our country.  § §With a sought-after product and a brand that is a household name, we know that what keeps us there is our team’s commitment to robust systems, processes and being client centric.   Signature Homes has been the winner of the ‘Supreme Franchise System of the Year’ award and continues to innovate and set the bar high. We believe in investing in building our people’s capability with our award-winning training programs ensuring that our teams deliver a service that keeps our clients happy and coming back time and time again.§ § §All about the role§ §Our New Home Consultants work with our clients as trusted experts putting together solutions from our range of plans and services and they can be the difference in ensuring a wonderful home building experience.  They are masters at understanding people’s needs, have the knowledge to find the solution that fits the bill, and the people skills to be a trusted advisor through a big decision making journey.  § §The role will take you from lead management, managing phone enquiries, face-to-face consultations – walking a client through the process from enquiry to sales conversion and much more.  You may even be putting on a hard hat and walking around a ‘build in progress’.  You will know your customers and the industry, spending much of your time learning all you can about new products, materials and design ideas.  § §The hours are varied, there are evenings and weekends involved and as it is very much a business that you will be building, you will want to work all the hours you can to reap the rewards that can be achieved.  Our top consultants have been able to achieve flexibility as to how they run their workday once they have built a good foundation. § § §So, what do you need in your toolkit?§ §Well, we sell dreams so our team needs to be exceptional at helping people realise theirs.§We can teach most people about the building industry; however, there are some things you will need to bring to the table to be successful in this role:§ §·  §A proven ability to build rapport with customers §·  §A passion for understanding needs and finding solutions for your customers§·  §Experience of managing a sales pipeline – analytics, reporting, sales planning, forecasting and organisational skills. §·  §Business planning – creation and execution of ‘go to market’ plans§·  §Robust understanding and experience of the sales process, buyer personas and demonstrable success of hitting sales numbers§·  §The ability to be a whizz on systems – our team works with design and estimating software so being quick to learn new systems and to be competent in IT  will be a prerequisite in your application.  § §What we will do to help you be successful§ §The successful candidate can be assured of a comprehensive training and development programme to grow their know-how and confidence quickly. On top of that, we will also give you marketing support to drive lead flow and all the tools you need to be able to sell a great product and service.§ §Who are we looking for?§ §The common thread with all of our New Home Consultants is that they want to earn a six-figure income and retain some of the benefits that come with being self-employed; however, they still want the support of a larger company to give them the ability to be part of a team.  § §Our most successful consultants have one of more of the below and that’s what we look for in our new recruits:§ §·  §Previous business management experience and or ownership.§·  §A proven high performing sales career§·  §A background within the building industry as designers, project    managers or builders, or new home consultants.§·  §Senior managers looking to leave the corporate world & looking to develop their own future.§·  §Successful commission-based sales history.§ §Earning potential§ §This is a self-employed contract role: you are remunerated for successful house sales.  A retainer will be provided for the right candidate during the training period. Our successful New Home Consultants are earning $100k plus within 18 -24 months and many go on to earn salarys north of $250K§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

We think globally but operate locally. A not-for-profit, who reinvests income to advance global best practice in procurement and supply for the public good.§  §Today, there is a focus and understanding of supply chains like never before. People across the globe are appreciating the importance of supply chain continuity as they scramble for basic supplies and services. Procurement and supply is intrinsically placed to be a real change agent and driver for the greater good. Themes such as ensuring the security and continuity of supply of goods and services, as well as the focus on obtaining value for money from suppliers, continue to be very important for all organisations, as well as issues such as sustainability, shared values and ethics are core not only for the profession but also for the wider society to address; and CIPS is positioned perfectly to drive this agenda forward. As the professional body, CIPS has a crucial role to play in making this a reality for organisations both large and small, public and private, as well as to promote the profession as an exciting, responsible place for people to pursue their careers. To also improve the capability of the profession through the promotion of CIPS membership and education; supporting the  team, in sustaining and increasing membership and education pathways, by maintaining networks with education bodies and members of CIPS and the profession. You'll also be responsible in managing, identifying, generating, and delivering retail and B2B business across the whole spectrum of CIPS products and services in New Zealand, ensuring strong revenue growth and increased future business opportunities.§ §  §Location -  this role is w§ork from home based so you can be based in any major NZ locations; jobText: TXT/50691100.txt	§Territory Manager - Timaru§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Territory Manager - Timaru§§Advertiser: §GrainCorp§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §New Business Development§§§§§§A shared passion for our people.§Our people can be proud that, as a leading international agri-business, we provide an increasingly important service across the food and beverage supply chain.§   §About our team§GrainCorp Feeds is a national animal feed business, based in Hamilton NZ, dealing directly with corporate and farming customers across New Zealand. GrainCorp Feeds offers a comprehensive range of high-quality liquid and dry dairy and calf feeds suitable for a variety of feeding systems and developed to improve on-farm production, reproduction, performance and profitability. We are local at heart with the backing of GrainCorp, one of Australia’s largest agribusinesses.§   §About the role§We are looking to secure a solutions focused Territory Manager for our upper South Island region - with the successful indivudal ideally based out of Timaru.   §As a driven, proactive and self-motivated sales and business development professional, you will join our growing GrainCorp Feeds business and be responsible for customer retention, partnering with our customers to add value and new client acquisition. This is a rewarding time to join our business as we are experiencing a strong period of growth and there are exciting innovations to support you and our cusotmers to success. In addition, the role requires you to meet/exceed sales targets; create sales strategies to target customers; implement sales and marketing initiatives; forecast demand and providing regular market feedback. §    §About your experience§The successful individual will present with valuable experience within the Agricultural Sales environment with a proven track record in account management/sales and/or business development.  § § §Experience within the animal feeds/farming or nutrition industry would be highly regarded however we have an open mind as to what success might look like in this position; therefore if you are a vet nurse (for example) who is also interested in customer success and providing solutions to customers we would love to hear from you too!  § § §Regardless of your previous experience, you will pride yourself on your ability to build and develop new relationships, and to manage your own time effectively.  You will have proven experience of successful lead generation, cold calling and customer acquisition.  You will supply your customer base with an exceptional level of service and will be highly knowledgeable on your product offering and value proposition.  You will be proficient in MS Word and Excel allowing you to complete your weekly reporting and administration duties in a timely and professional manner.  You will have the drive and ambition to grow your role further and to continuously develop your skill set, capability and experience. In return we will support you by providing ongoing training and development. § § §If you’re looking for an opportunity to showcase your highly collaborative working style in a growing international business, we welcome your application. §* This role will require some travel and overnight stays away from home. A clean and valid drivers license is essential for this role. §    §Do you share our passion for contributing to the success of a diverse, international team?§  §At GrainCorp, we value and respect the different perspectives and experiences our people bring to work each day. We aim to increase the diversity of our workforce – leading to a range of different thinking, perspectives and ideas that create the innovation we need to drive better business results. We aim to have a work environment where everyone feels included and everyone can realise their full potential.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50698124.txt	§Sales & Customer Services Co-ordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sales & Customer Services Co-ordinator§§Advertiser: §Cristal Air International Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Sales Coordinators§§§§§§At HRV we believe everyone should love the feeling of coming home. In fact, since we started in 2003, we've helped over 500,000 Kiwis love the feeling of coming back to a warm, dry home. We provide whole-home solutions, covering Ventilation, Water Filtration, Heat Pumps and Air Conditioning. Since 2017 we have been part of Vector Limited, so you know you have the backing of one of New Zealand's largest companies.§ §About the role:§ §A fantastic opportunity to join HRV in an exciting new role responsible for coordinating sales and customer services for key clients. Recently HRV has teamed up with a well-known New Zealand group, so ideally this role will suit someone who has both sales and customer care experience within a highly professional environment.§ §In this position, you are the first interaction the customer has with HRV, so strong communication skills to create the best initial impression, is crucial. Building great relationships with both the business partners and their customers is key to being successful in this role. Going above and beyond to provide customers with a premium sales/service experience from start to finish, comes naturally to you.§ §This is a newly created position servicing business partners and their customers nationwide, so there is the expectation you take full ownership and make this role your own. You would also be responsible for training an additional person, so in your absence, the customer continues to experience a seamless level of service§ §Responsibilities include:§ § §Responding to enquires received via 0800 number, email and website, promptly and efficiently§ §Developing a regular communications channel with HRV's business partners§ §Identifying further sales opportunities§ §Liaising with Operations staff nationwide to book home assessments and installations§ §Completing sales quotes based on the technical information received§ §Processing invoices and related customer payments§ §Ensuring all documentation is complete and meets business requirements§ §Tracking & coordination of new and annual service bookings through CRM§ §Following up with customers post completion of the job to obtain feedback§ §Reporting on key metrics weekly, monthly, quarterly and annually as required§ §Identifying any issues and offering solutions.§ §Providing training to all affected parties when there is a change of process§ §We are looking for a great team player who thrives in a busy environment. You will be proactive and enjoy dealing with people, you will also have:§ § §Previous sales and customer service experience with a strong commitment to quality and professional outcomes§ §Outstanding written and verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with a positive attitude.§ §Proven experience resolving customer issues§ §Computer literacy - Word and Excel§ §Attention to detail and accuracy§ §Personal resilience, positivity, and enthusiasm§ §An interest in cars would be an advantage§ §A current & valid NZ Drivers licence and the flexibility to travel domestically when required§ §What's on offer:§ §This is an opportunity not to be missed. At HRV, we are committed to our team of over 200 staff, we're here to develop your skills, create a diverse and respectful workplace and ensure that you succeed with us. You'll be offered a competitive salary, and the opportunity to grow your skills and make a real difference in a supportive, high-performing team.§ §HRV engages a workforce made up of individuals with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. HRV respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion.§ §We welcome applications from all individuals. If you require assistance or accessibility support from us during the application and selection process, please do not hesitate to call us on §06 272 7950§ §Please note, all applicants must have the legal right to work and live in New Zealand. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test and relevant background checks.§ § § §To learn more about us visit www.hrv.co.nz.§ §To apply for this job click Apply Now careers.hrv.co.nz/Vacancies§ §Job code: 5239094 § §Applications close: 08 November 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50698320.txt	§Call Centre Sales Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Call Centre Sales Advisor§§Advertiser: §Employsure§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Sales Representatives/Consultants§§§§§§The opportunity §Employsure has experienced astonishing success across ANZ over the last 9 years creating exceptional growth within our Outbound Sales Team. This role is designed for those who love sales, are eager to excel, are committed to exceeding expectations and also have fun along the way!§As a B2B Call Centre Sales Advisor, you will cold call and identify small/medium sized businesses who may be in need of Employsure’s award winning subscription services. You will then book for one of our Field Sales reps to have a face to face presentation of our services and what we do.   §Plenty of companies talk about great earning potential, at Employsure, we walk the talk with a starting competitive base salary commission with OTE being $85,000. With our clear career path you can increase this base earning and also move into more senior office/field based opportunities within our sales team. We offer a clear commission structure where you earn on everything you bill as well as quarterly bonuses and also incentives such as overseas trips, iPads, early finishes etc.  §What does the day to day look like?§ § §Cold calling potential small business clients and discuss Employsure’s award winning service offering§ §Working towards set KPIs (sales targets) and be eager to achieve/over achieve on these§ §Set appointments for our BDMs (Field Sales staff) to meet these small businesses to further discuss Employsure and service offering§ §   §What experience do I need to apply?§ § §At least 6-12 months previous cold calling sales experience is required for this role§ §A high level of drive and hunger to succeed§ §Ideally experience working within a B2B sales capacity, however B2C experience will also be considered§ §   §What will I get in return?§ § §The opportunity to earn big!! OTE $85k with high achievers well in excess of $100k+ per year§ §A transparent commission structure, weekly monthly and quarterly incentives which range from early finishes, tickets for events, quarterly bonuses to name a few!§ §Clear career path where you will know exactly what KPIs you will need to hit to be rewarded with higher titles, remuneration and commission, overall increasing your OTE and high earnings!§ §A fun, supportive and collaborative team environment. Our Sales team really come together to celebrate every win across the team§ §An active social committee who organise company wide events and celebrations§ §Perks for longer tenure within the business such as 5 days extra annual leave after 2 years and also extra annual leave when probation is passed§ § §What to expect - Recruitment Process§Once you have applied, you will be sent an email/text with link to complete your First Interview! This text response questionnaire will help us get to know you better, and in return you will get a fully customised personality profile§with a coaching tip! It usually takes about 10-15 minutes to complete so make sure you are in a quiet and comfortable place. If successful following this, you will then be invited to speak to one of our Recruiters for an interview!§Why join Employsure?§Our vision is to Build Better businesses starting with our own. Employsure works directly with small businesses to ensure they stay on top of rapidly changing legislation. Whether it be dealing with a difficult employee, facing a claim or reviewing health and safety, our clients can rest assured we have them covered.§The opportunities are endless, with personal and professional growth being one of our top priorities. In addition, we offer our employees remarkable benefits. If you are looking for a role that can match your goals, we want to hear from you.§With a global track record of over 30 years of success, this is your chance to join an industry leader who prides itself on expertise and innovation at an exciting time in the Australian and New Zealand market.  §Become a part of our exciting journey. Apply now§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Inbound Sales Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700860.txt	§Inbound Sales Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inbound Sales Lead§§Advertiser: §ReachMedia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sales§, §Sales Representatives/Consultants§§§§§§Inbound Sales Lead§Join a high performance Sales culture with uncapped commission model§Responsible for clients’ advertising campaigns§Hybrid working model with a combination of office and WFH§Permanent Opportunity§You are an experienced advertising Sales Executive that will own our inbound funnel.  You’re going to be talking to clients. A lot. You’ll consult on their campaign briefs, develop the right advertising solution to target the right audience and leave them delighted, because you’re brilliant at customer service.  You will have a strong understanding of the sales process, be able to build relationships, and close deals.  We will set you up for success.  We have proven advertising products across design, print, letterbox, digital and mobile channels.  We will provide you with training, scripts, templates and tools required to delight our clients.  You will have a target and be supported by a high performing Customer Experience team to achieve your target.§ §Who we are:§ReachMedia is the leader in direct advertising solutions in New Zealand.  We use data and insights to reach our customers' targeted audience.  Our capability includes a combination of offline print and letterbox distribution along with online digital and mobile advertising solutions. Enjoying the backing of a global parent, IVE Group, we are able to draw on local expertise with global best practice to provide effective advertising solutions to clients.  We are unique in the market and are now looking to change the game by connecting online and offline marketing channels to create a world where marketers and business owners make smarter and better justified decisions with their marketing dollars. § §Our Values:§§Good Humans§ - We do as we would expect others to do. §Better Every Day§ - We strive to be better in all senses of the word, both as an individual and as a business.§Freedom & Responsibility§ - We are responsible for ourselves and how we show up at work, which allows us many freedoms.§Will to Win§ - We exhibit a strong will to win in the marketplace and in every aspect of our business.§ §You will:§Own the inbound funnel and sales process through to deal closed§Talk to customers and build campaign briefs§Excel at building and maintaining strong relationships §Consult with clients on their advertising needs§Be outcome orientated and be able to delight your clients§Be skilled at working under pressure§Be flexible and able to adjust quickly to changing market dynamics§Thrive on connecting people to a vision and love to bring better experiences to our clients§Resonate with, and be able to model our values (above)§ §You have:§2+ experience in sales (or similar industry experience)§A hunger for closing new leads§Demonstrated achievement against sales targets§Used Hubspot CRM (or similar) and can build sequences§A demonstrated ability to work in a high performance environment§Excellent verbal and written communication skills§The ability to make things happen§ §We are excited to be able to share this opportunity to join our Customer Experience team and support our clients to reach an audience of millions of people each week.§ §To apply:§Please apply to this ad with a CV and Cover Letter that includes the answer to the question:§How have you delighted a customer?§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Work with a luxury brand offering superior service; get excited sending others on their own motorhome journey.  § §This is a fantastic role to showcase your sales skill set working in conjunction with your core passion for the outdoors, our country NZ and what it has to offer to those who wish to experience it from a motorhome. § §Working with a high-end luxury brand, this quality product will need a professional with a sophisticated style and a sense of wit building trust and genuine rapport to be successful in the role.  I am in search of an experienced professional with a level of maturity who would have an appreciation for the care, time and consideration that goes in to such a purchase.  Daily you will liaise with clientele who are familiar with a high level of service and professionalism.  Your integrity, charm and transparency will be expected and ultimately assist you in obtaining the clients “buy in”.  Naturally you will be someone who is eager to know your product inside and out with the know-how and technical knowledge should a question be asked.  Working within a sales team with a dedicated sales manager who all thrive on positive vibes and an upbeat “can do” approach, this is a role working as an individual contributing to an overall collective team output.  Working within an office setting surrounded by the main operations of the business, you will also have access to the product on site.  As part of this role you will be required to follow up on leads, inform and follow through to "closing" as well as supporting clientele who visit and want to view the product in its entirety.  The process from start to finish, from the first phone call and first visit will become part of your clients’ experience where they will receive the superior service this business stands by, firsthand. § §This is an exciting product and you will be liaising with people who are jubilant to be in a position to finally take on their adventure of a lifetime; a dream they have been working towards.  Become part of it and allow them to make their decision with you and your top-quality offering. § §Show an interest by calling Tara Fisher directly on 021 940 298 for a confidential chat or click “apply”.§  §§§§
